reviews.text:
Quite a long review this.
1. Location| well if you like prostitution drugs and beers this is for you. If you don’t… then turn left out of the hotel door. There are better locations.
2. Service| ok it was busy, so fair enough but I was told I had to change rooms half way through the week (I wasn’t the only one) but the room was an upgrade so ok.

The room key!!!! In 4 days I had to go to reception 4 time because apparently it’s my fault for putting my phone near the key (Germany still stuck in 2005 it seems) the receptionist was always grumpy.
3. Room service| forget that. There isn’t any of note.

Overall it’s a good hotel that suffers from a bad location. Probably wouldn’t go back for that reason.

Of roof top bar. I see lots complaining here but there is a strict dress code  that’s a good thing. Wear something nice and you’ll be fine. :)

Avoid this hotel. Be very careful when they’re asking for a deposit. Try just to pay cash and receive the cash back.
The rooms are very average with no facilities for what you pay.
They charged us 100 Euro as a deposit for one night.
On the departure, they said that it takes 60 working days to refund the money because they’re working with people’s money.
It’s now over 3 months, we still haven’t received the money, after multiple communications, they are now asking for our bank details!!!!!
So imagine that if I hadn’t been this much persistent and communicating.
They would steal the money, which probably they have done it for many people and they hadn’t noticed. Shame on them.
I have now escalated this with relevant authorities

Location is ideal for anyone wanting Reeperbahn. Its a 30min walk to Rathaus, and main shopping.
The room was spacious, but the bed a bit uncomfortable and the pillows were very thin. No hand soap, only shampoo. No door on the shower. And towels are hanging in the toilet.
Bathtub has no soap available to use.

A last minute booking proving to be a rip off.
Hotel entrance is rather imposing. However, reception staff would definitely require some more encouragement in engaging with guests, instead of just handing out a tablet asking you to fill in all details on your own to check-in.
After this check-in experience, went to my room, which was indeed spacious with truly breathtaking views over the city and the Elbe and that's all the luxury a little less than 500euro for one night can buy you in this hotel...
No kettle.
No coffee machine.
No phone device; guess room service and/or emergency are not a thing around here.
No shampoo/soap in the bathroom dispensers; with no phone in the room, one would have to exit the room amidst a shower to seek for shampoo/soap.
Towels torn obviously overused.
Bed and pillows rather uncomfortable, most likely overly used.
No breakfast was offered for the abovementioned rate.
Location may be ideal for accessing the party area of St. Pauli/Reeperbahn and the 20th floor bar may be having the most breathtaking views over the Elbe, but these elements do not compensate for the rest of the above experience.
Sincerely cannot see why to consider ever going back or recommending the hotel.

Nice hotel, but I had problems by paying for parking at stock -1.
The Automat could not accept my MasterCard after trying a few times. Then I had to pay cash 50 Euro. When I came home I could see on my bankaccount that the Automat also had taken 50 Euro from my MasterCard. So I have payed 100 Euro for parking 2 days. I think the Hotel must send me 50 Euro. Kind Regards Steen Rasmussen
